question: Which league does Shack Scott play in?

**Breaking News: Shack Scott Takes the Court in NCAA Division I Men's Basketball**

In a thrilling development for college basketball enthusiasts, Shack Scott, a talented young player, has been confirmed to be participating in the prestigious NCAA Division I men's basketball league. This exciting news has sent ripples of excitement throughout the sports community, with fans and analysts alike eagerly anticipating Scott's performances on the court. According to credible sources, Scott suited up for Wagner College during the 2017-2018 season, solidifying his position as a key player in the NCAA Division I men's basketball league. This elite league, comprising the top-tier colleges and universities in the United States, is renowned for its high level of competition and rich history of producing talented athletes. "We're thrilled to have Shack Scott on our team," said Bashir Mason, Head Coach of Wagner College's men's basketball team. "His skills and dedication to the sport are undeniable, and we're confident he'll make a significant impact in the NCAA Division I league." Data from the NCAA reveals that Wagner College, a private liberal arts college located in Staten Island, New York, has a strong reputation in the league, with a winning percentage of .542 in the 2017-2018 season. Scott's participation in the team undoubtedly contributed to this success, showcasing his abilities as a formidable player in the NCAA Division I men's basketball league. "Shack Scott's presence on the court is a testament to the league's commitment to fostering talented athletes," said Dan Gavitt, NCAA Senior Vice President of Basketball. "We're proud to have him representing the NCAA Division I men's basketball league, and we look forward to seeing his continued growth and success." With Scott's impressive skills and the NCAA Division I men's basketball league's rich history of producing top-notch athletes, fans can expect an electrifying season ahead. Stay tuned for more updates on Shack Scott's journey in the NCAA Division I men's basketball league.
content.source_2:
**Former College Hoops Star Shack Scott Finds New Home in Belarusian Second League**

In a surprising turn of events, former Wagner College basketball player Shack Scott has traded in his sneakers for a pair of cleats, making a successful transition to professional soccer in the Belarusian Second League. Scott, who played for the Seahawks during the 2017-2018 season, averaged 12.5 points and 6.2 rebounds per game before deciding to pursue a career in football. The 6'7" forward's athleticism and agility have proven to be valuable assets on the pitch, where he now plays as a striker for FC Baranovichi, a team based in the Brest Region of Belarus. "I always had a passion for soccer, even during my basketball days," Scott said in an exclusive interview with our publication. "When the opportunity arose to play professionally in Belarus, I couldn't resist. The competition is fierce, but I'm loving every minute of it." Scott's decision to switch sports may have raised eyebrows, but his impressive stats in the Belarusian Second League have silenced any doubters. Through 10 games, he has scored 7 goals and notched 3 assists, helping FC Baranovichi climb to 5th place in the league standings. "Shack's been a game-changer for us," said FC Baranovichi head coach, Andrei Klimovich. "His size, speed, and agility have given opposing defenders fits. He's still adjusting to the nuances of the game, but his work ethic is unparalleled." According to data from the Belarusian Football Federation, Scott's goal-scoring rate is among the top 10 in the league, and his aerial ability has earned him a reputation as a threat in the box. While Scott's transition to soccer may have come as a surprise to some, those close to him say it's a natural fit. "Shack's always been an exceptional athlete, and his competitive drive is unmatched," said Wagner College basketball coach, Bashir Mason. "I'm not surprised he's found success in another sport. He's a winner, plain and simple." As the Belarusian Second League season enters its final stretch, Scott and FC Baranovichi are poised to make a push for promotion to the top division. Whether or not they achieve that goal, one thing is certain – Shack Scott has found a new home in Belarus, and he's making the most of it.
